title: Another Municipal Roundtable
summary: The newsletter discusses several key legal topics, including a municipal roundtable discussion on emergency services, Medicaid billing clarifications under Washington state law, and safety citations related to unpreventable employee misconduct.
compressed_content: - Municipal Roundtable Details: Fire departments are invited to discuss emergency response protocols and public safety measures.
- Medicaid Billing Clarifications: Washington state law defines ALS, BLS, and EMS services, impacting reimbursement eligibility.
- Safety Citations: WISHA compliance requires thorough safety programs and consistent enforcement to avoid unpreventable violations.
search_text:

... GEMT being law, and the Attorney General may have a new administrative burden.
... 'An ALS assessment does not necessarily qualify as an ALS intervention.'
... 'ALS assessment alone does not qualify for Medicaid reimbursement under Washington law.'
RCW 49.17.060 Washington Industrial Safety and Health Act (WISHA).
... 'No citation may be issued by L&I if there is unpreventable employee misconduct that led to the violation.'
key_findings: Municipal roundtables are being held to discuss emergency response protocols and public safety measures.
Medicaid billing under Washington state law requires clear definitions of ALS, BLS, and EMS services for accurate reimbursement.
WISHA compliance requires thorough safety programs, documentation of discipline actions, and consistent enforcement to avoid unpreventable employee misconduct.
recommendations: Fire departments should ensure proper documentation of discipline actions to support WISHA compliance.
Avoid reliance on preventable citations as proof of compliance with WISHA standards.
Thoroughly review safety programs and enforce them consistently in practice.
